Pre-Game Insights: India have taken a few steps in the right direction, especially with their top three batters showing more intent.
Their goal is to be the best fielding side at the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia.
Sri Lanka have added Niroshan Dickwella and Dhananjaya de Silva to the T20I squad with the two injuries.
Ruturaj Gaikwad was ruled out of the first T20I after he complained of pain in his right wrist, which is affecting his batting.
To infuse some experience into the batting line-up, Sri Lanka could replace Kamil Mishara with Danushka Gunathilaka, while Dinesh Chandimal could make way for Dickwella.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The last time India were to play an international match in scenic Dharamsala, rain didn't allow even a coin toss.
Given the last T20I in Dharamsala was played back in 2016, it's difficult to say how the pitch will behave.
